Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0221, 0.0] Step 2: Create the 2D sketch (face_1) Create a new 2D sketch (face_1) on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system and draw a rectangular shape with the following dimensions: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0662] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0662], End Point [0.0, 0.0662] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0662], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch (face_1) Scale the 2D sketch (face_1) by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch (face_1) into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 45.0) and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch (face_1) by 0.0088 units towards the normal direction and 0 units towards the opposite direction of normals respectively. Additional information The length of the part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.0088 units.</description>
